column4: i installed ubuntu 9.10 onto my dell dimension 2400, and the screen resolution is 800 x 648, but when i had ubuntu 9.04 i had 1024 x 768 resolution, how can i fix it?
have a look in System->preferences->display
it only has 800 x 648, none other
you have a problem I had a while ago, give me a sec while I find the fix.
run the following command, then restart your PC. Hope it helps: sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg did not work
hmm, then Im not sure. Im going to assume this is the same monitor?
and that you have installed video drivers.
that may be your problem
ubottu is only a bot. Im the one who called his factoid.
Im not sure what the issue is, but I would assume its a driver thing.
thats alright. I would make sure 'restricted' sources are enabled, and then System -> Administration -> hardware drivers
i checked 'restricted' in software sources, then went to system-->adminastration-->hardware drivers and it came up with none
you have to "reload" using the Synaptic Package Manager (if you havnt already)
then I don't know. Sorry i couldnt help.
then maybe you have to create a xorg.conf file. Give me a sec I might know how to do that.
(im just guessing from here on out, but it might be worth a shot). Someone told me to run "sudo nvidia-xconfig" to create a xorg.conf file.
assuming your card is an nvidia one.
that also might need the nvidia drivers.
it said commmand not found
hmm, ok. then Im not sure.

dragon_, i tried to create a xorg.conf file by following ubuntu's instructions, http://www.ubuntu.com/getubuntu/releasenotes/910 (bottom of page) and it didnt work, then i tried this page, http://www.cyberciti.biz/tips/create-a-xorgconf-file.html and this page http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/How_to_create_xorg.conf and none of them worked
I wouldn't know. If it is that important to you, you could consider doing a fresh install again.
